events.name: Friday Hacks #106 - Building side projects: the timeline, triggers and stages that every builder has to experience
events.description:
For our second Friday Hacks of the semester, we're having Chee Aun, a web developer, talking about the side projects.

Date/Time: Friday, Jan 29 at 6:30pm 
Free pizza is served before the talks. 

# Building side projects: the timeline, triggers and stages that every builder has to experience.

#Description

He's built a lot of things. From small web applications to desktop applications. From small libraries to browser add-ons. From basic demo projects to web-based multiplayer games. Some of his interesting projects include: life (a timeline viewer), hackerweb (a readable HackerNews web app) and MooEditable (a simple web-based WYSIWYG editor). More of his projects here: http://cheeaun.github.io/. More of his side projects adventures here: http://cheeaun.com/blog/2016/01/building-side-projects/.

# Speaker Profile

Lim Chee Aun is a web developer from Malaysia, currently based in Singapore. He can design and code at same time, well, realistically one at a time. He dabbles around with mostly front-end technologies, always keeping up-to-date with the latest products, constantly learning new things and never stopping to build useful applications for himself and other people.
events.location: Video Conference Room (COM1-02-13), School of Computing, National University of Singapore

events.name: TGIFHacks #44 - RESTful Web API
events.description:
This week, at TGIFHacks, we will present to you how to design a RESTful API with Django and Python. 

RESTful API is a web API, which are interfaces for people to use web services conveniently

Do come down to our workshop as long as you are interested in developing an web API!

There is no setup required for this workshop, just bring your laptop with a browser!

events.name: Shapeways Singapore Meetup
events.description: Time to ring in the new year with our first Singapore Shapeways Meetup for the 2016! Welcome all to join us, and if you have already dabbled in 3d modelling or printing, feel free to bring your projects for all of us to fawn and geek over too! As usual we will have showcase of 3d printed pieces in different materials from Shapeways and designers who have used Shapeways to be around and share about their experiences/tips & tricks. ;) This will be the week also of the Inside 3D Printing Conference in Singapore so hope to have some other folks visit and hang out too! See you all! =)
events.location: Funbie Studios, Funan DigitaLife Mall, Singapore

events.name: Maker Faire Singapore 2016 - Maker Townhall
events.description: Maker Faire 2016 planning is in full swing! Join us at SUTD on 27th or 29th January to take a look at the space for Maker Faire, find out about the different ways in which you can participate in the Faire.
events.location: SUTD Singapore University of Technology & Design, Think Tank 15, Building 1, Level 5
